pages.title: comment_rules
pages.text: Comment Policy##Community, Comments and BadasseryLetâ€™s take a minute to talk about the Badass Digest comments and community, the rules and regulations and what your opinions are about them all. By DEVIN FARACI May. 05, 2012 I just did something historic: I shut down a comment thread. It was on the â€œColdplay cover the Beastie Boysâ€ article, and the closing comes on the heels of a bunch of bannings over the last few days, so I think this is a good time for all of us to talk together about this site as a community. First of all, I want to reiterate that I believe in community and comments on websites. I look at popular sites with zero comments on articles and Iâ€™m baffled. How is that possible? I like the idea of readers being involved and part of the discussion. Wait, scratch that - I LOVE the idea. I started my â€˜careerâ€™ as a film critic because I was a commenter on a site. I think the back and forth of the web is what makes it all valuable. We used to have rules on the comments section but they got stripped away when we changed content management systems. Maybe we need to put the rules back up, but in the meantime I want to run down some of the important ones: 1) This is our house. We like having you over here, but itâ€™s still our house, and weâ€™re going to have our own rules. If you donâ€™t like them, you donâ€™t need to be in our house. 2) As this is our house weâ€™ll make our own judgment calls about what reflects poorly on our house. If youâ€™re running around dropping racist or sexist or homophobic comments (even if theyâ€™re not full of swear words or slurs), weâ€™ll kick your ass out. It turns out that weâ€™ll do the same if you decide to be a passionate defender of unbridled mediocrity. The site name is â€˜Badass Digest,â€™ and while the definition of â€˜Badassâ€™ is pretty broad, there are some things that just donâ€™t fit. Like Coldplay. 3) You donâ€™t have to agree with us. I donâ€™t expect you to, and I like when you disagree with me. But youâ€™re going to have to disagree in a basically respectful way. That means attacking the OPINION, not the person giving the opinion. Iâ€™m pretty serious about this. Iâ€™ll accept some comments on the edge about me, but if you attack the personal qualities of the other writers, youâ€™re toast right away. 3b) If you accuse us of being in the pocket for some studio or movie or whatever, youâ€™re out of here. I donâ€™t have time for that stuff, which I actually find MORE offensive than telling me Iâ€™m gay. 3c) That first part goes for other commentersâ€™ opinions, by the way. 4) If you post something libelous about a celebrity Iâ€™ll ban you. Note that â€˜So and so is an assholeâ€™ is not libelous. â€˜So and so is a rapistâ€™ when they havenâ€™t been accused/convicted of rape IS. I canâ€™t believe I have to even say this, but it came up last week.Those are the really hard and fast rules. Here are some â€˜suggestionsâ€™ that arenâ€™t quite rules: a) Donâ€™t make corrections in the comments. Nobody likes freelance copy editors. If youâ€™re really concerned about us making a typo, thereâ€™s a â€˜Contact usâ€™ page, or just email me at devin at badassdigest.com. Correcting typos in public makes you look like a dick. a1) Just so weâ€™re clear, that doesnâ€™t apply to when weâ€™re dead wrong on a fact that is part of the point weâ€™re making. If youâ€™re disagreeing with my opinion on a subject and that opinion is based on bad facts, that shit is fair game. b) Donâ€™t say â€˜meh.â€™ It makes you look stupid. c) Donâ€™t come into a thread just to say how little you care. Donâ€™t get into an argument with someone where your whole premise is â€˜itâ€™s stupid to argue about this.â€™ We care, and we think itâ€™s worth arguing about. d) Shut up about Film Crit Hulkâ€™s style. If you donâ€™t like it, donâ€™t read it. We have plenty of other stuff here and hopefully some of that is to your taste. His articles are well-marked. e) Be expansive! we like in-depth comments. Be funny! We like wit. Be saucy! We have no restrictions on word use. Be crazy! We like well-argued opinions that stray far outside the mainstream. Donâ€™t be safe! This isnâ€™t a middle of the road site, so donâ€™t feel the need to conform. I feel like the comments and commenters are a huge part of this site. I love reading the comments, even the ones that sort of piss me off. Especially when they piss me off by disagreeing with me and being RIGHT. I start checking comments as soon as I post a story, and I love seeing familiar names pop in to drop great wisdom and good jokes. And Iâ€™ll admit to being torn about closing the Coldplay article. Maybe I should have let it go on. But I donâ€™t believe that the customer is always right, and I think I would have done the same if the thread was people vigorously defending Jack & Jill. This site is no place for mainstream, populist, generic swill. I honestly hate the idea of a new reader coming to a site called Badass Digest and seeing 80 comments defending Coldplay. Itâ€™s simply not right. Your turn. Iâ€™m not necessarily looking for positive reinforcement here, so you donâ€™t have to just post â€˜Good work!â€™ or whatever. Iâ€™m not keeping a list of people who â€˜supportedâ€™ me. I used to write for a site where being â€˜home teamâ€™ was everything, and I have come to realize what a horrible, cult of personality system that is. Iâ€™m more interested in hearing honest criticisms and advice for how to better maintain the community here. And Iâ€™m also interested in your opinions on me closing the thread. Iâ€™m not interested in your opinion on Coldplay, though - just the action I took.

posts.title: MarkDownè¯­æ³•å­¦ä¹
posts.text: MarkDown è¯­æ³•å­¦ä¹  çŸ¥è¯†æœ¬èº«å¹¶æ²¡æœ‰å‘Šè¯‰äººä»¬æ€æ ·è¿ç”¨å®ƒï¼Œè¿ç”¨çš„æ–¹æ³•ä¹ƒåœ¨ä¹¦æœ¬ä¹‹å¤–ã€‚ åŸ¹æ ¹ å·²ç»å—å¤Ÿäº†ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„htmlç¼–è¾‘å’Œæ¨¡å—åŒ–ç¼–è¾‘äº†ã€‚ä»”ç»†æƒ³äº†æƒ³æœ‰æ²¡æœ‰ä¸€ç§æ‰€è°“èƒ½â€œå¥½è¯»åˆå¥½å†™â€çš„ç¼–è¾‘æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå‘ç°[MarkDown] []è¯­æ³•çœŸçš„å¾ˆé€‚åˆäº†ã€‚[MarkDown]:
